Mauna Kea (/ ˌ m ɔː n ə ˈ k eɪ. ə / or / ˌ m aʊ n ə ˈ k eɪ. ə /, Hawaiian: [ˈmɐwnə ˈkɛjə]) is a dormant volcano on the island of Hawaii.Standing 4,207 m (13,802 ft) above sea level, its peak is the highest point in the state of Hawaii making the island of Hawaii the second highest island in the world.
May 24, 2018 · For accurate, factual alerts and updates, the Hawaiian Volcano Observatory is the most comprehensive, reliable news source you could possibly go to.

Episode 61g lava flow continues with many breakouts; firehose enters the sea at Kamokuna ocean entry. Hawaii's Kilauea volcano continues the long-term eruptive activity that began in 1983 with lava flows from the East Rift Zone (ERZ) and a convecting lava lake inside Halema'uma'u crater.

Following the pattern of Hawaiian volcano formation, Mauna Loa would have started as a submarine volcano, gradually building itself up through underwater eruptions of alkali basalt before emerging from the sea through a series of surtseyan eruptions about 400,000 years ago.

Observatories are institutions that are actively engaged in volcano surveillance and, in most cases, are responsible for warning authorities and the public about hazardous volcanic unrest. This is a helicopter view of the Hawaiian Volcano Observatory (HVO), perched on the rim of Kilauea caldera.
